3.3.1.title: Create & Retain Audit Logs
3.3.1.officialRequirement: Create and retain system audit records to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity.
3.3.1.why: Without logs the SOC is blind. If MVL can’t reconstruct events, we fail CMMC and DFARS 7012 incident-reporting within 72 h.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Forward Windows Event IDs 4624/4625/4688 and Linux auth.log to **Azure Sentinel** via the AMA agent.
Enable **Microsoft 365 Audit (Advanced)** for Exchange, SharePoint, Teams, and Defender alerts.
Configure **Azure Monitor Diagnostic Settings** on every resource group to push JSON logs to Sentinel’s Log Analytics workspace ‘mvl-prod’.
Set **Sentinel Data Retention**: 90 days hot, 2 years in Azure Archive (meets CMMC + IRS 1075).
Deploy **Acronis Cyber Protect** immutable S3 vault replication every night for off-site copy.
Automate log-schema validation with **Kusto function `validateLog()`**; failures fire a P1 ticket.

employeePerspective.title: What This Means for Employees
content: Your log-ins, file access, and admin actions are recorded for security—no impact on performance.
Viewing or downloading large CUI bundles triggers an alert; if it’s legit, no worries, just be ready to confirm.
Help Desk use these logs to troubleshoot, so detail = faster fixes.

managementPerspective.title: Business Impact & Risk Management
content: Median incident investigation time drops **70 %** with centralized logging (IBM 2024).
Provides documentary evidence for DoD, cyber-insurance, and potential litigation.
Supports root-cause analysis → continuous improvement; FY-24 root-cause insights removed 11 recurring mis-configs.

mvlTips: Sentinel workbook **“Audit Heatmap”** shows log volume by source—red if daily flow ▼ 10 %.
Immutable Acronis copy stored in Gov-cloud ‘mvl-audit-vault’; retention policy = 7 years.
Quarterly log restoration drill proves we can read month-old data within 2 h SLA.
steps: Install Azure Monitoring Agent on all servers.
Turn on M365 Advanced Audit per tenant-settings.
Create Diagnostic Settings templates in Azure Policy.
Script Acronis S3 daily sync; test restore.
Document in Playbook AU-01; link in LMS.

quiz.q: Where does MVL store its off-site, immutable copy of audit logs?
quiz.explanation: Acronis provides write-once object lock so logs can’t be tampered with.

3.3.2.title: Trace Actions to Individual Users
3.3.2.officialRequirement: Ensure that the actions of individual users can be uniquely traced to those users.
3.3.2.why: If we don’t know *who* changed or downloaded data, incident response stalls and blame lands on MVL.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Force **AAD Premium P1** sign-in—every token carries a unique user Object-ID logged in Sentinel.
Disable local admin account SID-500; require named admin with PIM elevation.
Endpoint **Sysmon** installs capture parent-child process chain with user SID.
Linux uses **sudo iolog** with session ID transmitted to Sentinel.
Sentinel analytic *‘Non-attributable account activity’* fires if Username == ‘UNKNOWN’.

employeePerspective.title: What This Means for Employees
content: Use your own account—no sharing; all activity is logged under your name.
Admin duties? Elevate via PIM so we have the audit trail.
Shared service accounts are forbidden unless rev-controlled and vaulted.

managementPerspective.title: Business Impact & Risk Management
content: Enables disciplinary or legal action when malicious activity occurs.
Meets **NIST IR 8259** recommendations on accountability.
Reduces MTTR by 50 % because SOC can ping the exact user immediately.

mvlTips: Weekly Sentinel query checks any event where `PrincipalName == 'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM'` *and* interactive.
Developers use **GitHub signed commits** so code changes trace to individual keys.
steps: Remove local admin SID-500 via Intune script.
Enable sudo logging on Linux hosts.
Educate staff on account sharing policy.

quiz.q: What tool logs Windows process chains with user SID at MVL?

3.3.3.title: Review & Update Audited Events
3.3.3.officialRequirement: Review and update audited events periodically.
3.3.3.why: Threats change. If we still log floppy-disk events but not Azure Key Vault, we’re sunk.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Quarterly log-source review during Cyber Architecture Board (CAB) sprint: compare to MITRE ATT&CK updates.
Sentinel Content Hub rules updated monthly; new event types tagged ‘NEW’ for 14 days.
Any new critical SaaS (e.g., Jira) must have log ingestion onboarding checklist before go-live.

mvlTips: CAB ticket **‘LOG-SRC-2025-Q1’** tracks additions; artifact goes in CMMC folder for assessors.

quiz.q: How often does MVL formally review its audit-event list?

3.3.4.title: Alert on Audit Processing Failures
3.3.4.officialRequirement: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.
3.3.4.why: If logs stop flowing, attackers step in. Fast alerts mean we plug the gap within SLA.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Sentinel **Health Monitoring** workbook alerts if any table’s EPS ▼ 80 % for 15 min.
Azure Monitor Alert: Log Analytics ‘IngestionLatency > 30 min’ sends PagerDuty P1.
Acronis job-status failure triggers SOC Teams post.

quiz.q: What signals a log-ingest drop in Sentinel?

3.3.5.title: Audit Reduction & Report Generation
3.3.5.officialRequirement: Provide audit reduction and report generation to support analysis and investigation.
3.3.5.why: Raw logs = noise. Reduction gives SOC actionable context fast.

content: Sentinel **Bookmarks** & **Hunting Queries** summarise multi-day events into 50-line evidence sets.
Custom **Power BI** report ‘Audit-Insight’ slices by user, time, and MITRE technique.

3.3.6.title: Correlate Audit Repositories
3.3.6.officialRequirement: Provide centralized management and correlation of information system audit records.
3.3.6.why: Correlating cloud + on-prem is how we detect lateral movement.

content: All logs funnel to **single Sentinel workspace ‘mvl-prod’**; UEBA ties AAD, Defender, Zscaler, Acronis.

3.3.7.title: Provide Audit Record Integrity
3.3.7.officialRequirement: Provide audit reduction and report generation to support on-demand analysis and reporting.
3.3.7.why: Tampered logs invalidate evidence; WORM storage + hashing keeps integrity.

content: Acronis vault enables object-lock; Sentinel raw data hashed with SHA-256 every 24 h.

3.3.8.title: Time-Stamp Audit Records
3.3.8.officialRequirement: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

content: NTP → time.windows.com; Azure resources inherit.
Sentinel marks all logs in UTC; workbook converts to Gulf (+04:00) for users.

3.3.9.title: Protect Audit Tools & Info
3.3.9.officialRequirement: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
3.3.9.why: If attackers delete logs we lose the crime scene. RBAC + immutability stops that.

content: Sentinel ‘Log Analytics Contributor’ role only; no ‘Contributor’ on workspace.
Acronis vault is write-once; delete via legal hold only.
Break-glass Global Admins can’t delete Sentinel tables—Azure RBAC denies.
